item.title: Tailwind CSS v1.8.0
item.description: Tailwind CSS v1.8.0 is now available, with font-variant-numeric support, experimental dark mode, and more!

item.title: Utility-Friendly Transitions with @tailwindui/react
item.description: Announcing the first release of @tailwindui/react, which introduces a <Transition> component for utility-first enter/leave transitions.

item.title: Introducing Heroicons.com
item.description: Today we're launching the official Heroicons web experience, which makes it easier than every to search for icons and quickly copy them to your clipboard as Tailwind-ready HTML or JSX.

item.title: Tailwind CSS v1.7.0
item.description: Tailwind CSS v1.7.0 is now available, with gradients and more!

item.title: From Nine Hundred to One: How We Hired Robin Malfait
item.description: Back in May we published our first job posting for a full-stack developer to join our team. This is the story of how we worked through almost 900 applications, and eventually hired Robin Malfait, a talented developer from Belgium who is starting with us today.

item.title: Tailwind CSS v1.6.0
item.description: Tailwind CSS v1.6.0 is now available, with animations and more!

item.title: Simon Vrachliotis Joins Tailwind Labs
item.description: Today we are super excited to share that Simon Vrachliotis has joined the development team at Tailwind Labs.

item.title: Welcoming Brad Cornes to the Team
item.description: Back in June, Brad Cornes joined our company as our very first team member. We didn't have a blog to announce it back then, but better late than never right?

item.title: Tailwind CSS v1.5.0
item.description: Tailwind CSS v1.5.0 is here, now with component variants, responsive container variants, focus-visible support, and more.

item.title: Introducing Tailwind CSS Typography
item.description: Until now, trying to style an article, document, or blog post with Tailwind has been a tedious task that required a keen eye for typography and a lot of complex custom CSS. That's why today we're excited to release @tailwindcss/typography — a plugin that lets you easily style vanilla HTML content with beautiful typographic defaults.

item.title: Building the Tailwind Blog with Next.js
item.description: One of the things we believe as a team is that everything we make should be sealed with a blog post. Forcing ourselves to write up a short announcement post for every project we work on acts as a built-in quality check, making sure that we never call a project "done" until we feel comfortable telling the world it's out there. The problem was that up until today, we didn't actually have anywhere to publish those posts!

item.title: Introducing linting for Tailwind CSS IntelliSense
item.description: Today we’re releasing a new version of the Tailwind CSS IntelliSense extension for Visual Studio Code that adds Tailwind-specific linting to both your CSS and your markup.
